result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremiah J. La Barge was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeremiah J. La Barge

defendant.name: La Barge, Jeremiah J.
defendant.address: 520 Chicog Street, Apt. B P.O Box 67, Lac du Flambeau, WI 54538

records.addlTxt: 2:04 PM Defendant Jeremiah J. La Barge appeared by video, in custody.  ADA Brown  appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Paul J Augustyn appeared by video for Jeremiah J. La Barge.  Defense has received offer from the State and would like to proceed with sentencing.  Attorney Augustyn states he did review plea questionnaire with defendant, however they have not been in the same place at the same time to have him sign it.  Waiver of preliminary hearing.  Rights given.  Court finds defendant is making a knowing and voluntary waiver of right to preliminary examination.  Court finds probable cause.  Bound over for arraignment on an information.  State to e-files information in court and provides copies to defense.  Defense waives formal reading of information.  Right to be personally present at today's hearing explained to defendant.  Defendant confirms that he would like to proceed without being personally present in court.  Court finds that defendant agreeing to proceed by phone/video means, and waiving right to be personally present in court for today's proceedings.  Plea of guilty entered.   Court reviews plea questionnaire with defendant. Rights given.  Court finds that defendant is knowingly and voluntarily waiving right to jury trial and plea is found to be entered knowingly and voluntarily.  Found guilty.  Court imposes 6 months in county jail, concurrent to 21CF43 and 21CF298 - STAYED.  Court orders 2 years probation with conditions: AODA assessment and follow through with any counseling or treatment deemed appropriate by agent. Maintain absolute sobriety Obtain and Maintain full-time employment at discretion of the agent. Felony and Misdemeanor court costs imposed with DNA surcharges.  65 days credit in the event of revocation.

9:06 AM Defendant Jeremiah J. La Barge appeared by video, in custody with the Vilas County Jail.  ADA Dennis Brown appears in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Paul J Augustyn appeared by video for Jeremiah J. La Barge. Victim rights legislation has been complied with. Defense confirms receipt of criminal complaint, waive formal reading.  Defense received global offer this morning from the State.  Request for a status hearing to be set forward with the potential to go to PLEAS.  Court grants request.  Bond motion.  Denied by Court.  Bond continued.
Status hearing scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Status hearing on July 12, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Motion hearing on July 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: 10:46 AM Defendant Jeremiah J. La Barge in court, in custody, without counsel.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney rights given. Defendant confirms receipt of complaint.  Victim rights legislation has been complied with.   Defendant advised to contact public defender's office.  Court disqualifies itself and will be reassigned.  Bond continued.  State to contact Judge Knox-Bauer for scheduling.

Defendant appears by video from the Vilas County Jail without counsel.  ADA Brown appears for the State of Wisconsin.  No complaint filed yet.  ADA Brown speaks to the incident that occurred that resulted in the defendant's arrest. Bond set at $1,000 Cash with condition: No contact with T.B(1963).  Bond form.  Motion made to forfeit cash bond in cases 21CF359, 21CF298 and 21CF43.  Court to hear motion at next hearing.  
Hearing scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 10:15 am.
